website_summaries.verdict: A popular grain mill that is hard to beat thanks to impressive grinding abilities.
pros: With a sleek design, 1200W power, and 20-cup capacity, it's capable of almost effortlessly grinding up to 5 cups of grain per minute
We love that the texture controls produce fine or course grain
Backed by a limited lifetime warranty
cons: Slows down a bit when grinding coarse grains like corn
It's important to secure the grain bin properly prior to operation to prevent particles from escaping the unit

customer_reviews.title: The lady on the phone treats complaints like it’s our wrong misdoing and not on them
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy the machine. Their customer service is horrible- in case it breaks they only allow a free repair service within ONE MONTH since the purchase... it’s a joke. It broke 2 nd time I was using it. The setting I was on was according to the instruction- Wheat on setting 2nd...The lady on the phone treats complaints like it’s our wrong misdoing and not on them. Do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Tatyana Mironova

customer_reviews.title: Great Results
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Have only had it about 1 week. The only reason for 4 stars is that I realized that I had to brush the last 1/2 cup of grains into the feeder otherwise they just sit there. The tip to add corn starch around the rubber ring of the bowl works very well as it tends to stick. On you tube someone suggested putting non-stick cooking spray on the ring. Doesn't sound like a great idea to me. Milled 2 pounds of wheat berries in less than a minute. The resulting whole wheat bread turned out very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steviesmom

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I am a cancer survivor. So when I started grinding my own flour. I did my research. You would be amazed at the taste differences from this to store bought flour. The acidic taste you get when making bread from store bought flour is actually the flour going rancid. I will not go back!! Palouse brand grain is the best I have found. I do not receive any kick back from them. Just letting you know my opinion. I am 1 1/2 yrs strong 💪🏻
customer_reviews.author: DMarie

customer_reviews.title: ... grind my own flour and this mill is a wonderful thing to behold
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to grind my own flour and this mill is a wonderful thing to behold. It is so easy to use. There is no mess with flour dust, and clean up is a breeze. It grinds a lot of flour in one cycle, which is really convenient. It looks so nice I have left it sitting on my countertop where it is always ready to grind. In case you can't tell, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I've been milling my own wheat and corn for many years, and wanted an easier way than how I had been doing it. I did a LOT of research on the electric grain mills on the market right now, before deciding on this one. I'm really happy with my choice, and absolutely love the results I get from this grain mill. As long as you follow the directions in the instruction booklet, you shouldn't have any problems. If you're getting inconsistent results, watch some of the "how to" videos online and play with the settings until you know the machine better. It's worth the effort, because this mill does an excellent job! I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Great Mill!
customer_reviews.text: Oh My Goodness!!! What a great mill. It grinds like a mad man. Just dump in the wheat and watch it disappear into the grinding wheels. It is a little noisy, but you should expect a grinder to by noisy. Ever chewed hard red wheat? Well don't do it... it's rock hard, this mill will do all the work for you. My only complaint is that they don't include a nice storage bag to store the unit in. An air tight bag to keep weevil form setting up home would be nice. Hasn't happened yet as my wife cleans it up nicely before storing it away in the pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Parker

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: This was our first flour mill. The container top doesn't seal well and it blows flour out. It also ahs been blowing partially ground pieces of grain out from somewhere inside so this is basically useless. We've used it 4 times and it doesn't work well. Each time it blows more and more junk out. Go with a different machine. I'd return this but We were gone most of the month after we bought it so I'm unable to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday grain mill
customer_reviews.text: Got this as an everyday addition to a manual grain mill that I already had. It works amazingly fast in comparison! I love the ease of being able to select both the coarseness and speed of the grind with the turn of a knob. I've ground all sorts of grains with this mill and it has handled every one without a hitch. It is also very easy to clean. The only thing to keep in mind is that it is quite loud while grinding but as it can grind an entire hopper full of wheat in only a couple of minutes I didn't find this to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: ThriftyByNature

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: All i can say is, great! If you want to grind your own flour this is the perfect choice. Price is good. Performance is good. It is loud but it grinds fast so not a problem. It will grind 20 cups of flour, but that is overkill for me. I watched several videos before I bought this item. Not sorry. If i had one complaint it would be the controls. However, this is probably necessary so that grain can be put in the hopper while the mill is off. It is just a little confusing which settings get course and fine textures.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. McDowell

customer_reviews.title: The price is reasonable for the quality and efficiency of this mill.
customer_reviews.text: This flour mill is excellent, the wheat flour is light and 'full of flavor'. My grandson loves Poppies, "Horsebread", seem to be running out of horsebread lately? The Bosch mill is very efficient it will grind wheat berries (5) cups in a little over a a minutes. Cleanup is fast & easy, noise is bearable but I use ear protection anyway. Love this Bosch, it's my 2nd, the first Magic mill was great as well, but was lost while moving from apt. The flavor alone of fresh bread will convince you to try one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Haben

customer_reviews.title: GREAT flour mill!
customer_reviews.text: I am more than happy with this mill! It worked beautifully! The only "issue" I have with it is the lid to the flour container doesn't create a great seal (a little bit of flour poofs around the lid). I'm sure we'll be able to find an easy fix for it but this is SO MUCH EASIER than hand cranking!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Nolen

customer_reviews.title: she FEELS GREAT! It is truly all about natural foods
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't for me, but my wife ABSOLUTELY LOVES IT! She has health issue that cause her to get sick from standard, store-bought sandwich bread, so with this to grind our own flour for a TRUE homemade bread, she FEELS GREAT! It is truly all about natural foods! This is the way to do it! (almost EVERYTHING in stores now have very harmful ingredients... Some of which you can find in commercial grade chemicals)
customer_reviews.author: Danny Wright

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't what I needed, but not at the fault of the machine
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a great review, but unfortunately wasn't what I was looking for. No fault of the machine whatsoever. Many people I know love it and swear by it. I will say that it will grind into a very fine powder pretty darn quick.
customer_reviews.author: Bodhi E.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The lid is flimsier than other's we've seen of the same model, but other than that. This has worked perfectly. We grind wheat at least once a week, and we've had it for over a year now with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: kORY

customer_reviews.title: very messy
customer_reviews.text: it does a good job of milling seed and grain into flour. however it leave a mess, dust was blowing out from underneath the motor. the machine wasn't seal correctly. everytime i use it i got dust everywhere. it's mess. not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bowl lid impossible to open!
customer_reviews.text: The bowl lid is so HARD I couldn’t opened it! I feel so irritated because my hands are sore now trying to opening.... not recommending ... and returning right now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this works great for our wheat berries
customer_reviews.text: this works great for our wheat berries. Turns them into flour perfectly. I do wish I could do things like Almonds and such, But to be able to make your own flour so freshly is pretty great. Only downfall is the lid to the bowl is soo extremely hard to open.
customer_reviews.author: christina kapteyn

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Only used it a few times and the motor started smoking. Motor is dead. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Warden

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works great. I make bread twice a week. I just milled my first wheat and I will make bread tomorrow morning. I love the fact that the flour will have all the health benefits that nature intended. Just remember, the flour will include the germ and the husk, so, it will have a courser than normal feel. I can't wait to see how well it turns into bread. Digestive tract, get ready for some easy work! :)
customer_reviews.author: Informed Consumer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. You have to make sure the bin is ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. You have to make sure the bin is all the way in otherwise you'll have flour flying out making a mess. Also Very loud and you can only a few cups at a time. The machine starts to smell like it's burning. Which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. Otherwise it does a good job. Lid is still very tight to open but directions say it should loosen. We will see
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Since my purchase, I have ground about 60 cups of frozen wheat berries which are room temperature when they come out as flour. The controls took me a little time to figure out and I usually get a mix of fine and medium fine wheat flour. I am glad to be able to grind my own organic red wheat berries and make sourdough bread from the fresh flour. Delicious and nutritious!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Free

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Although I have used my VitaMix blender ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Although I have used my VitaMix blender to grind grain with the dry container, I wasn't happy with the texture. I also have a hand grinder which is okay for course flour, but I wanted to use 100% whole wheat without adding white store bought flour. I had a hard time deciding if I should spend more money on the NutriMill. I'm glad I did. The flour is finer, the mill is fast and clean up is easy. I recommend this grain mill.
customer_reviews.author: gardener

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this flour mill! I make bread every week and I love this mill!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more having to deal with flour shortages
customer_reviews.text: The mill is fast and works great. We've been milling whole wheat to flour and using it to make our own pizza crust and bread. No more worrying about finding organic whole wheat flour and no more having to scrutinize ingredients on store-bought bread!. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Grain Mill
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grain mill after a different brand that I had wore out. I have had this for several years and have had no troubles. It is well built and solid. It does a great job at grinding wheat. The one thing I wish it had is an on/off switch, rather than just plugging it in to turn it on. I love that measuring is easy. Just fill the top with wheat and that is the perfect amount to grind to fill the flour container at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: wagsmom

customer_reviews.title: Makes great whole grain bread flour
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased this last month for grinding whole spelt and wheat for our sourdough bread. So far it has been amazing. Our 100% whole grain bread and bagels are soft and rise well. The flour is fine and the dough comes out feeling very soft. We had previously been running the berries through a manual grinder and then through a coffee grinder. The dough was much more stiff and the bread did not rise as well. We love it so far and hopefully it will last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: addams

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: A very nice grain mill and going strong three years later with regular use. Only flaw is that the flour receptacle leaves a tiny gap once it is placed securely in the grinder. Once you begin to grind, a bit of flour will then puff out of this gap throughout the grinding process. I compensated for this by draping a towel over the gap so the flour would just fall to the counter for an easy cleanup. The motor is also quite loud, but acceptable. Just don't use it when the baby is napping or somebody is watching the telly.
customer_reviews.author: Alien Country

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit but one issue to be know about.
customer_reviews.text: The grain mill works as advertised. Very large capacity, easy to clean. It does however have one issue. It is possible to start the mill without the collection container being fully engaged. Now there is a mark on the base to indicate when the container is fully engaged however one doesn’t always remember to double check this mark. When you don’t, blizzard city. Not sure why they didn’t use a lockout switch like you find on food processors.
customer_reviews.author: AgingKeeper

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool for avoiding processed bread food
customer_reviews.text: Makes great flour. it is truly difficult to get the lid on: you have to coat the rubber gasket with flour to get it to fit in place. It's loud of course, but it grinds away and makes flour. A medium size Glad plastic container holds just enough grain to fill a Tupperware flour container. Now I can grind local wheat and heritage einkorn wheat and know exactly what is going into the bread along with the fresh flour.
customer_reviews.author: SPV Gardens

customer_reviews.title: I have used this three times and the fourth time ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this three times and the fourth time, it doesn't work at all. I tried to contact the company but have not heard back from them.
customer_reviews.author: jl

customer_reviews.title: I’ve been using this for a few months now. ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for a few months now. I grind rye, wheat, teff, small amounts of beans, lentils. Works as advertised. I run it outdoors for easier to minimize flour dust inside my house during cleanup. The unit doesn’t shoot much dust into the air during use, but you’ll always end up with some dust as your open it to retrieve flour and clean it
customer_reviews.author: zach cain

customer_reviews.title: Nice mill. Quieter than previous models
customer_reviews.text: This mill is easy to use, and easy to clean. I only use it for wheat and it performs very well. It is more quiet than previous models.
customer_reviews.author: landofoz

customer_reviews.title: Our Second Machine
customer_reviews.text: We bought our other machine over 8 years ago and have used it non-stop since that time grinding all wheat for a 6 person family. We have used wheat montana only and the machine got used nearly every day. Finally a couple of months ago it died. It does not appear there are any decently priced replacement parts and a little more than the cost of a replacement motor it was cheaper to buy a new unit. This newer unit does seem a little quieter and has a few minor design changes for the better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fetters

customer_reviews.title: Does not perform as promised
customer_reviews.text: This mill cannot be sealed. When I grind grain it blows it all over the room. I would like to hear if I am doing something wrong with this mill. I have had mills before, but none have blown flour out the sides.
customer_reviews.author: gerald oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Mills are loud, but this one was surprisingly not as loud! It is a work horse, lovely and I have loved the versatility it provides in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: LJBohman

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Oh! I love this grinder. I love how you can load the top with the grain before turning it on. You can't do that with a whisper mill or any other grain mill. Speedy and efficient. Does the job well! Not too loud!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: It broke after 6 years.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mill for six years. It has worked great. This morning there was a flash of electricity and it shorted out. I was hoping it would last at least 10 years for the price.
customer_reviews.author: K.R.P.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase?  YES!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time grinding wheat (or anything for that matter). I found the directions to be easy to read and complete, putting it together was uncomplicated, and the final product was fantastic. I am very pleased with my new grinder/mill.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C.

customer_reviews.title: It's magic
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. We have had it since Christmas and have been using it at least 3-4 times per week for grinding hard wheat. It is very easy to use and makes flour just like store-bought and very quickly. It is about as loud as the average vacuum cleaner. It produces no discernible dust. We use a dedicated paint brush to dust off the insides when we are done. So it is also trouble-free. I am very glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Lowflyer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mill we have had. It works so well for the bread I bake weekly.
customer_reviews.author: Brocante Elegance

customer_reviews.title: It grinds teff
customer_reviews.text: This is the 5th one I bought in about 8 years. For myself and for gifts. We all love it. We use it to grind Teff to make (teff injera) Ethiopian food. And also whole wheat to make bread.
customer_reviews.author: Getachew W. Selassie

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. I can make any kind of flower for baking that I want.
customer_reviews.author: Jetta

customer_reviews.title: Finest grind
customer_reviews.text: This mill was better than I expected. The flour is more finely ground than a previous mill I had purchased. It is also easier to clean than most.
customer_reviews.author: F. Kathleen Keller

customer_reviews.title: Does what is says.
customer_reviews.text: Just started baking bread, and wanted to see if milling my own grain makes a difference. This machine does the job quickly, and is about as loud as I would expect it to be. The instructions are easy to use. Make sure you've got the holding tray in place or you will have flour all over the kitchen. My fault for not paying attention. Works well, and I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Fredo

customer_reviews.title: A little noisy but works well
customer_reviews.text: Grinds up flour for homemade breads very well happy with product so far
customer_reviews.author: Ted M.

customer_reviews.title: Mills great flour, easy to use and clean!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mill to make bread flour from the wheat and rye I grew this year. It’s easy to use and makes beautiful flour.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder, short life
customer_reviews.text: We bought a second one because it is a great grinder. The first one only lasted a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Alvina

customer_reviews.title: This machine is performs beautifully
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I can say bad about this machine. It’s quiet compared to the one I owned for 20 years (magic mill). Easy clean up. I suggest you watch the YouTube for easy operations.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Bertholf

customer_reviews.title: I bought this in Jan 2016. today on 9/6/2016 ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in Jan 2016. today on 9/6/2016 with may be less than 10 times of usage, it died today. While grinding wheat berries, it suddenly stopped. I put the trip button in and tried one more time. But then smoke started to come out, and there was plastic burning smell. Looks Iike I can't return to amazon. Will have to call the company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and durability. It gets the job done every time
customer_reviews.author: Dale Hunter

customer_reviews.title: It took a few tries to get the end result we wanted but ever since we had the settings dialed in it works awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and made sure to test run/clean the machine first. It took a few tries to get the end result we wanted but ever since we had the settings dialed in it works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Navjot Chaggar

customer_reviews.title: Love this mill
customer_reviews.text: It does a wonderful job grinding up all kinds of grains. I've even done chickpeas, which I wasn't sure if it would do or not, but I did a great job. I've done all kinds of grains in this thing and it always does a wonderful job. It is noisy, think shop vac, but it's a grain mill, so what would you exspect. Just don't run it when everyone asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Mill
customer_reviews.text: Combined with a Bosch Universal Plus mixer, this mill has quickly become the most used small appliance in the kitchen. My son, who didn't like 'wheat bread' now loves freshly milled whole wheat bread, with the Nutrimill and mixed with the Bosch Universal plus. I go from whole wheat to hot bread in just a little over an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Zumbrun

customer_reviews.title: I liked it but will return because the lid to the ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked it but will return because the lid to the canister is impossible for me to close.......It is so stiff because of the rubber gasket, that even if I put on flour or oil I cannot close or open it with out great struggle. If you have weak hands, arthritis or any other problems or weakness this product is going to be very difficult to use. Opening or closing it caused stress on my hands and wrists.l
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Butler

customer_reviews.title: Love my grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love the large bowl and especially having no flour dust landing all over the place( when bowl is inserted properly). I'm actually grinding in my kitchen !
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet compared to 2 others we’ve owned.
customer_reviews.text: A little messy, but that’s expected with what you’re doing.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Crittenden

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I only use it to mill bread flour. A little noisy but it mills so fast that it’s not a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Quiet! Very family compatible!
customer_reviews.text: Wheat mills scared my children. Jet engine sound in the kitchen made them afraid. I wanted them to learn to mill grain and make bread; but they ran as far away from the ktichen as they could. I sold my "jet engine" mill to a friend and bought this one in hopes I could mill grain when ever the mood hits me. Problem Solved!
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: OH wow this is much better than the mill i got for my table mixer
customer_reviews.text: OH wow this is much better than the mill i got for my table mixer. Best that would do was meal size milling this makes real flour. Now perhaps my bread will do better.
customer_reviews.author: Jack (NMI) Stecker

customer_reviews.title: I like how much flour it holds at one time
customer_reviews.text: I like how much flour it holds at one time. Although it is advertised as quieter than others, don't lie to yourself. It is still loud. But works well and the adjustable options for the fineness of flour is pretty fun to experiment with.
customer_reviews.author: Super Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Wheat Grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I really love my wheat grinder. It is quieter than I expected, and it doesn't blow wheat dust every where when I grind. I did have a little problem with one of the buttons sticking, but costumer service was TOP NOTCH and sent me a prepaid shipping label to get it repaired. Wonderful product for the price, and I would highly recommend it to someone who is looking for a quality wheat grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Trina Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Read Reviews
customer_reviews.text: I think I'm going to send back. I have to wear a mask for so much dust. I actually keep trying just in case I'm doing something wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Mirmie Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: It's not as I thought course I need little course grain I try after month I bought it's return window close no choice I have to keep it bed choice to buy
customer_reviews.author: RAJENDRA

customer_reviews.title: Great investment! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Once I figured out how to get the container back in properly so that it would seal, THEN, I loved it! It grinds really nice!
customer_reviews.author: Nana-x6

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves the Grain mill, it was recommended to her from her sister who also has one. It's a bit noisy but oh well it works great. The best part about it that now she has it, she is making more delicious baking goods. It's a bit pricey but is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Hem

customer_reviews.title: good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time, works great, doesn't take up a lot of room. The only reason I gave it a 4 was because I thought I could grind sprouted grain with it and the directions say you shouldn't. Would have been nice to know before hand, but I'm not really blaming them. I should have done a little more research. Other than that, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal for a Quality Item!
customer_reviews.text: This item performed better than expected. It will mill 20 cups of flour at a time and takes very little time doing it. There will be dust leaking out if the seals are not tight, but this is user error, not a product issue. Would recommend to an home bakers. A professional might do well with it, but a larger machine would be recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey R

customer_reviews.title: When I returned item, company did not refund all the money.  Kept part of money
customer_reviews.text: Expensive and only grinder for wheat. Cannot use grinder for Nuts & herbs
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Report

customer_reviews.title: Works okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mill finger millet and few other millets. Even though machine does the job it’s hard to find good quality Miller’s. So returned it
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Nutrimill Plus. It works fantastic. I would recommend to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Nutrimill
customer_reviews.text: We have used this mill perhaps a dozen times so far on wheat and kamut. Breads and biscuits from both are great with flour that is freshly ground. This mill does not have much range in course-to-fine settings, but it is acceptable to me. It is about as loud as a sweeper when running. The system is closed and filtered to such an extent that almost no flour dust is emitted into the kitchen. Perhaps those who had issues with dust getting out did not push the collection container in until it snapped in place. Clean-up is not bad either. No issues so far. We shall see how well it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: OldTechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great grain grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I love grinding my own flour & the Nutrimill makes quick work of it. Very happy with my purchase & love using it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great mill
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and clean. I have only ground wheat in it, but would like to try chickpeas and rice. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: I use this all the time!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great grain grinder. I use it to grind beans, grains into flour. It allows us to make multigrain breads, tortillas, cookies, etc. It does an amazing job and has been doing a good job for over a year now. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: A whole new positive experience
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st grain mill purchase and whole baking experience. I am not dumb,yet was so afraid of using this new kitchen tool. It's not a cheap investment. But, Sheesh, it's easy to use. It's clean and quick. It's easy to cleanup after and the grain is beautiful. I am extremely satisfied with my Nutrimill Grain Mill. I have baked by hand and have been a flour snob buying higher end flours for years for my baking, but I must say I really do like this whole experience and the nutritional benefits. Very satisfied. Don't be afraid to make the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: One for us and another for a gift.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Nutrimill we've purchased. Much quieter than our 20 year old magic mill, which finally started blowing flour dust all over. Our daughter in law is also into freshly ground grains, so we got together, pooled our money and bought one for her birthday.
customer_reviews.author: R. Egg

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Love it! Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I once had a stone wheat grinding mill and you never heard LOUD until you heard that! This mill is quiet, clean and the flour is beautiful. I read other comments about flour dust all over and I had absolutely none. I will really enjoy having this wonderful machine in my kitchen when bread prices soar. It was worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.author: Connie Guest

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it one time,but easy to clean. Had no problems with flour dust. Did a great job grinding the hard Red Winter Wheat Berries and did not think it was too noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... is the first mill I have owned and I love it. I did a lot of research before ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first mill I have owned and I love it. I did a lot of research before I chose this and I'm glad a I did! I does what it says it will do. I mainly use it for wheat berries and corn. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: woodturners wife

customer_reviews.title: No instructions included
customer_reviews.text: Like the product, but I had to find instructions online.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Nutrimill Grain Mill
customer_reviews.text: The advertising stated this mill would grind corn. It does but it requires constant monitoring. The kernels get stuck requiring shaking or constant hand agitation of the corn in the feed hopper. When the kernels get stuck it causes over heating and burned flavors To keep from over heating corn meal I have to freeze corn be for grinding. This is an added step. The corn meal is too fine. There is not enough adjustment with the machines controls. This machine probably makes great wheat flour. Not so good if you like a coarser grind.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for making me look good.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Mother in Law, and she loves it. Thanks for making me look good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to push the bin in all the way or you'll get a flour shower
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my K-Tec mill of 20 yrs. This one is quick and quiet and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCarville

customer_reviews.title: Great mill
customer_reviews.text: I have used my Nutrimill for two months and I am very happy with it. It is just as it should be. My only critique would be that the container that holds the ground flour is very hard to open and close, even after dusting with flour.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nason

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Not having ever used an electronic wheat grinder before, I didn't know what to expect. But I am really impressed with this--it was worth the price. It is very quiet--I have two cats that run away when the vacuum is turned on or the doorbell rings--it was quiet enough that they didn't scurry out of the kitchen together! It grinds smoothly and I really like the coarseness options--perfect, depending on the bread or dish I am making. Lastly, the plastic bucket is easy to clean. Also, I chose 2 day shipping and it got there in one day!
customer_reviews.author: A. Blake

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: it does what it do and what it do it does well
customer_reviews.author: RainMaker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Grain Mill
customer_reviews.text: This grain mill does and excellent job at turning the wheat berries into quality flour for breadmaking.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G. Pesante

customer_reviews.title: Does a quick job, perfect for indian recipes
customer_reviews.text: It mills grains very quickly, helps make us freshly grinded rice flour. It can be a bit noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Anupam

customer_reviews.title: Love my NutriMill!!!
customer_reviews.text: The NutriMill is so quick and easy to use and left no flour mess in my kitchen! I just floured the rubber seal, as others have recommended, prior to the first use. I love the large hopper and the ability to grind large amounts of wheat at a time. I do not consider this grain mill to be too loud as others have mentioned. I can easily carry on a conversation with someone while it's running. So far I have only ground wheat into flour, but I look forward to experimenting with other grains and such.
customer_reviews.author: kjjjmmkr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have used it several times and LOVE it. wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: I like how it grind but it stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working in the middle of the grinding cycle. I was only on my second cup.
customer_reviews.author: Gertrude Billy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! We had a hand mill and let me tell you this thing rocks!!! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great Mill
customer_reviews.text: I use this mill a lot. It's not to loud and doesn't need a lot of cleaning. It's a little bit bigger than I expected but I don't have a problem with that. It mills different kinds of grain (barely, spelt, soft wheat, oats)it makes very fine flour or more course, which ever you prefer and mills it very quickly. This mill doesn't have the mess the other ones did, I don't have to wipe two feet of counter top around the mill after I'm done milling. So it's a very good product and I have no regrets spending the money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!!
customer_reviews.text: I make my own bread and this was recommended to me. How did I ever do without this? :) This is sturdy, dependable and is a high quality product! Dont wait, it is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado1

customer_reviews.title: Love this grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grinder! A friend recommended it to me and I have been happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie brown

customer_reviews.title: Does not give extra fine consistency for Indian Flat bread(chappati) or Naan
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for INDIAN chapati, smooth and extra fine consistency can not be achieved no mater which setting or grain you use. So do not spend money if you think this mill give you that quality
customer_reviews.author: amit

customer_reviews.title: I love the lifetime warranty
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this grinder back in 2008. It has run without a hitch for all that time until the last month. It died on me two weeks ago. This grinder has a lifetime warranty on the motor so I sent it in to have it serviced. It took a week but I got it back. Since the motor had died they sent me a new grinder! I love the lifetime warranty. Highly recommend this grinder. Great product and awesome service.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hofhansl

customer_reviews.title: Love this mill!!
customer_reviews.text: This flour mill is wonderful! If I could give it 10 stars I would! It mills rice flour and other grains beautifully! Very powerful machine, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela L Solomon

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Much more quiet than any wheat grinder I've heard. Nice large hopper. Grinds from fine to course really well. This is a more expensive grinder, so I expected more. I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Nutrimill Home Grain Mill
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mill; it does precisely what it was designed to do, without insanely high noise levels, or dust clouds, from it's operation. Easy to use, easy to clean...my idea of product design & engineering! It's also lightweight, unlike the stone-grinders, and doesn't convert to manual operation, but that's ok; I don't have time to stand and grind our daily flour by hand, anyway:)
customer_reviews.author: S.

product_meta.title: NutriMill Classic High-Speed Grain/Flour Mill
product_meta.description:
Size:11" x 13" x 15" 13lbs. 20 Cup Bowl Capacity
Why mill your own flour, when it's so readily available? Commercial mills remove 30 percent of the wheat kernel, removing the most nutritious part of the grain to make white flour. Milling your own flour not only ensures that your flour is as nutritious as it can be, it has a wonderful taste that is lost to commercially made whole-grain flour.

NutriMill is the world's most popular maker of grain mills, and the NutriMill Classic has been its #1 selling mill for over 10 years! The NutriMill Classic electric grain mill uses a high speed impact chamber (also called a micronizer) with stainless steel milling heads to create flour from grains and beans. The NutriMill Classic has raised the bar for grain mill design with new features and abilities users have asked for—a combination of features found in no other impact mill. 

The new design of the NutriMill Classic's impact chamber allows you to put grain into the hopper before you turn it on with no risk of plugging the mill, which can happen with older mill designs. Even if stopped during grinding, the NutriMill Classic restarts again without trouble.

With the Nutrimill Classic you have the ability to grind from super fine, much finer than any other impact mill, to coarser flour you need for perfect corn bread. Its impact grain milling heads provide a 400% range of adjustment from fine to coarse, ten times greater than earlier impact mills. 

The NutriMill Classic allows you to grind up to 20 cups of flour at one time! Its grain hopper and flour bin are perfectly matched so you never have to worry about an overfilled mess. Convenient, powerful & fast: Just pour grain in the hopper, turn the NutriMill Classic on, and its powerful 10 amp, 1-3/4 hp motor does the rest, quickly producing your choice of fine, medium or coarse flour. The NutriMill Classic's impact grinding mechanism is self cleaning, and it operates dust-free, so grinding grain won't mean extra housecleaning later. Its one piece design, easy-grip handles, and light weight make the NutriMill Classic easy to move.

The versatile NutriMill Classic grinds wheat (both hard and soft), oat groats (dehulled oats), rice, triticale, kamut, spelt, dry beans, lentils, dent (field) corn, popcorn, dried sweet corn, split peas, buckwheat, barley, rye, millet, teff, quinoa, amaranth, sorghum, dried mung beans and soybeans. It will also grind dried, minimally-sprouted grain. The NutriMill Classic isn't suitable for herbs, spices, oilseeds like flax, chopped chestnuts or fibrous materials. Also note that when set for coarser meal texture, the NutriMill Classic's output remains too fine for making cereal grinds. The Nutrimill Classic is an outstanding machine for making a full range of flour and meal textures.

Protects nutrients: The NutriMill Classic keeps your flour at temperatures typically about 118° that protect the nutrients in your grains. Its new airflow design makes the NutriMill Classic the world's coolest-running impact mill. With a sound level about like a vacuum cleaner, the NutriMill Classic is much quieter than the first generation of impact mill designs. 

With a Limited Lifetime Warranty you can be sure your Nutrimill Clasic will output flour reliably for years to come.
feature_bullets: Advanced technology: Improved texture control, stronger milling heads, unique Force Flow sound/air chamber design which results in 50% noise reduction, improved motor cooling, and longer life.
Protects nutrients: The NutriMill Classic keeps your flour at temperatures typically about 118° that protect the nutrients in your grains.
Powerful 10 amp, 1-3/4 hp motor quickly produces your choice of fine, medium or coarse flour. Grind up to 5 cups of flour per minute.

Stainles steel impact grain milling heads provide a 400% range of adjustment from fine to coarse flour, ten times greater than earlier impact mills. grinds wheat (both hard and soft), oat groats (dehulled oats), rice, triticale, kamut, spelt, dry beans, lentils, dent (field) corn, popcorn, dried sweet corn, split peas, buckwheat, barley, rye, millet, teff, quinoa, amaranth, sorghum, dried mung beans and soybeans
Includes Grain Hopper Extension to increase capacty, Air Filter, and Separator Cup. Limited lifetime warranty
